oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ANALYSIS AND MODELLING OF ISSUES RELATED TO WAVE AGITATION CAUSED BY LONG-PERIOD WAVES IN A TOURISTIC MARINA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cusati, Luis Alberto
Pedroncini, Andrea
Besio, Giovanni
Taramasso, Angela Celeste
Puppo, Stefano
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Marina of Ventimiglia (Liguria, Italy) holds a pivotal position as a tourist harbor due to its proximity to the Port of Monaco, with direct connections facilitated by a high-speed shuttle service. The marina, which features a distinctive shell-shaped design, shortly after its completion in 2020, faced significant wave agitation issues. This study, performed utilizing numerical modeling, is aimed at achieving a comprehensive understanding of the key factors influencing wave agitation and formulating effective mitigation strategies. The analysis was further enhanced through the installation of four high-frequency water level gauges, which served to validate and calibrate the modeling findings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; waves.36
